prompt: How would an automotive engineer approach the task of improving the fuel efficiency of a hybrid vehicle? Include the use of simulations, real-world constraints, energy flow calculations, and how results would be documented and presented to stakeholders.

criteria.name: Problem Understanding and Engineering Objectives
criteria.description: Identifies key areas affecting fuel efficiency and defines goals clearly.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly outlines engineering objectives and identifies all major efficiency factors.
performance_descriptors.good: Defines goals and key factors with some explanation.
performance_descriptors.average: States general aim but lacks depth on influencing factors.
performance_descriptors.poor: Fails to define the problem or goals.

criteria.name: Application of Simulation and Analytical Tools
criteria.description: Uses simulation and modelling tools to analyze energy usage and design changes.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Applies simulations effectively with clear output interpretation.
performance_descriptors.good: Simulation tools used with minor gaps in interpretation.
performance_descriptors.average: Basic simulations referenced with little detail.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Simulation use unclear or incorrectly applied.
performance_descriptors.poor: No use of simulation or analytical methods.

criteria.name: Energy Flow and System Optimization Calculations
criteria.description: Performs energy-related calculations to support decisions.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Accurate energy flow modeling and component optimization.
performance_descriptors.average: Some calculations attempted but not comprehensive.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic math with unclear links to optimization.

criteria.name: Presentation and Communication of Results
criteria.description: Presents findings using charts, simulations, and technical summaries for stakeholders.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Well-structured report with visual outputs and professional tone.
performance_descriptors.good: Findings presented clearly with supporting visuals.
performance_descriptors.average: Summary provided but lacking visual or technical depth.

llm_questions: What factors influence the fuel efficiency of a hybrid vehicle?
How are simulations used in automotive engineering?
How is energy flow calculated in hybrid systems?
What real-world constraints must be considered in vehicle optimization?
How are results presented to stakeholders?
llm_answers: Aerodynamics, tire resistance, engine-motor coordination, and regenerative braking all influence efficiency.
Simulations test different configurations using models like MATLAB/Simulink.
Energy in/out is calculated using drivetrain models, battery dynamics, and efficiency curves.
Weight, cost, emissions standards, and driving behavior are key constraints.
Charts, diagrams, and executive summaries are used to convey results clearly.
